definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: A man was sitting at a corner, with a hat in each hand, waiting for handouts.
sentences.chinese: 一個人坐在牆角處，兩手各託一頂帽子，乞求施捨。

sentences.english: But even this prayer the tree didn't hvaccept the separ.
sentences.chinese: 可是以至這個乞求樹也沒有注意。

sentences.english: But I'm not gonna beg, so baby, come around to me.
sentences.chinese: 但我絕不會乞求，所以寶貝，帶着愛快到我身旁。

sentences.english: She prayed with him, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她當時簡直是在乞求他，她說。

sentences.english: The murderer entreated the judge for mercy, but was sentenced to the gallows .
sentences.chinese: 兇手乞求法官寬恕，但還是被判了絞刑。

sentences.english: James lived on without begging alms from others.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯沒有向別人乞求賙濟照樣過活。

sentences.english: A mid-aged woman is seeking inspirations.
sentences.chinese: 一箇中年婦女在乞求指導。

sentences.english: Tom taught his small dog to beg.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆教他的小狗舉起前腳做乞求狀。

sentences.english: Michael looked at him imploringly, eyes brimming with tears.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾滿懷乞求地看着他，兩眼淚汪汪的。

sentences.english: Begging, wishing, praying for them to come back.
sentences.chinese: 乞求，希望，祈禱他們能夠回來。

sentences.english: Narcissa began to cry in earnest, gazing beseechingly all the while at Snape.
sentences.chinese: 納西莎傷心地哭了起來，乞求地盯着斯內普。

sentences.english: Agitated, I caught myself pressing the White Tara against my chest, pleading with her for aid.
sentences.chinese: 焦躁不安的我把白度母按在胸前，乞求她幫幫我。

sentences.english: He knelt before the king and craved  for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 他跪在國王面前乞求寬恕。

sentences.english: “All of these products, ” he said, “are just begging me to kick them over.”
sentences.chinese: 他說，“所有這些產品都在乞求我把他們踢翻。”

sentences.english: He will never beg for his life.
He looked cold and hungry, raising his head and begging for food.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去又冷又餓，擡起頭向我乞求東西喫。

definition: to seek for/to hope to gain/desirous
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to give in charity/to give alms (to the poor)
